result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean S Vallejo-Olson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC (>2500-10,000 g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)4.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Same as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all of following by end of supervison. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:  all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge.  If revoked, to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaning due ando wing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
All applicable fees of supervision.

Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
Follow all rules of supervision. Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  No alcohol or drugs.  No possession, consumption, selling, distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.

timeConds.notes:
Defendant to report by 9/18/2015 by 5:00p.m.
First three (3) months are straight time.  
Final six (6) months will allow huber and Day Reporting Center.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sean S Vallejo-Olson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (17 pages) commencing SEPTEMBER 16, 2015, received and filed.  jm
Letter to defendant requesting additional information.
Defendant's pro se request for pass to visit grandmother.

Defendant Sean S Vallejo-Olson in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  5 YEARS 6 MONTHS with 1 day credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and/or the WI Substance Abuse program. 

The Court stayed the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years 6 months. 

Conditions of Extended Supervision / Probation:
- Serve a total of 9 months condition time. First 3 months are straight time and the final 6 months will allow HUBER and Day Reporting Center. Defendant to report by 9/18/2015 by 5:00 p.m.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter.
-  If Revoked the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Filed, Justice Point Report dated 9/15/2015

Defendant Sean S Vallejo-Olson in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for sentecing, however defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Sean S Vallejo-Olson in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial, however parties would like to proceed with a plea hearing instead.  Jury trial date of 08/17/2015 is vacated.
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Court DENIES state motion for remand.  Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Sean S Vallejo-Olson in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court to address Justice Point violation.  Court admonishes the defendant and does not amend bail.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22 for final pre-trial on 08/13/2015 at 8:30am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  Positive drug test.  Bail review scheduled for 08/06/2015 at 8:30am in Branch 22.

Defendant Sean S Vallejo-Olson in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Nick Cerwin for David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial, however defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Sean S Vallejo-Olson in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Marissa Luz Santiago for David Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests Final pretrial conference and jury trial.  Court advised defendant to keep in touch with attorney and follow conditions of Justice Point.   Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial, Branch 15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Sean S Vallejo-Olson in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.   Defense counsel needs additional time to review discovery with his client.    Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 15.  Status conference scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.   No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Defendant Sean S Vallejo-Olson in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Sean S Vallejo-Olson in custody.  Karen Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Status conference scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
